title: Sample Problem: Modular Exponentiation!
inpt: The input will consist of a single line of input containing three space-separated integers, a, b, and c.
subt:
For 10 of the available 100 marks, a, b, c ≤ 100.
For another 20 of the available 100 marks, a, b, c ≤ 10<sup>4</sup>.
For the remaining 70 marks, a, b, c ≤ 10<sup>8</sup>.
desc: Given three positive integers a, b, and c, output the smallest positive integer d such that a<sup>b ≡ d (mod c).
genr:
import random

maxval = [100, 10000, 100000000][int(input())]

a = random.randint(1, maxval)
b = random.randint(1, maxval)
c = random.randint(1, maxval)

print(a, b, c)
